intro: Scorzonera scoparia, commonly known as the mountain scorzonera, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow to orange, arranged in a composite head, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Scorzonera scoparia is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in alpine and subalpine environments.
